page.title: 15Family Life in Knockholt
page.content: There are families in Knockholt whose antecedents have grown up here for generations. Homes vary from small cottages to large houses, some modern. Few families still make their living from the land, but many commute to larger towns and London. This is a good place for growing families. Young children, should their parents wish, are taken to Mother and Toddler Group. At the age of three there is a Kindergarten with trained staff. At five they join the state assisted Church of England School. At eleven there are many schools a bus ride away. Most families have interests in the various village activities which cater for all ages and tastes. Some of these have their roots in the Church or the Village Club, still others are independant. Most families benefit from items using modern technology.
